newsitem.title: USA: SPR Inc cuts IPO terms for second time.
newsitem.headline: SPR Inc cuts IPO terms for second time.

text.p: SPR Inc on Thursday reduced the terms of its planned initial public offering for a second time, cutting the number of shares to 2.2 million and lowering the estimated price to $12 each.

The information technology services company first filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for an offering of 2.7 million shares at $14 to $16 each. Last month, it cut the estimated price to $13 to $15.
Of the total number of shares to be sold, 1.67 million will be sold by the company with the remainder to be sold by selling shareholders.
Smith Barney is the lead underwriter of the offering, which is due to be priced later Thursday for trading Friday on the Nasdaq under the symbol "SPRI".
